not too long ago, i was in a place in my life where i didn't want to be. i was depressed, stressed, and always worrying about something. i couldn't find a job, no matter how hard i tried, my parents kept sending me money, even though they didn't HAVE any, and my love life...pretty much sucked. I tried so hard to just stay, not happy, but content, with what i had. and i tried to keep my hopes up, that eventually, EVENTUALLY, things would change. they finally started to. i got out of bed every morning, and found a reason to smile. and now, i don't need to find one, i just do.

sali's in that place. the only difference between us, is that she's been in that place her whole life. wondering when things are gonna' change, and finally get better. i alwas feel so helpless. I can't MAKE her see life differently, or that the changes she wants to see happen need to start with her own self. i can't show her how everything is completely in her control. all i can do is listen, try to give helpful advice, and be as good of a friend as i can. but always feel so horribly for her. she's probably one of the closest people on this planet to me. she knows more about me than i do. but i can't help her. i've never been able to. i want to cry, but can't. i don't believe in God, but i pray for her. I know she's not going to change, but i try to help her anyway.

we were talking about how i was 14 and she was 13 when we met. she couldn't wrap her mind around it. it was so baffling to her. we've known eachother for almost five years now, and we've been through a lot together. not in the sense that we've both experienced the same things. but we've been right there for eachother the whole way through. through thick and thin, for worse or for better. i used to love her. i still do. but in a different sense now. i know i can't pursue a relationship with her because we're too different. but she's my soul-mate. it's strange, but it's true. we're perfect friends. we've grown so close to one another that we're more than that. we're actually siblings. we've only known eachother for about five years, but we know eachother's lives inside and out. we did grow up together. and i think that's why it makes it so hard for me to see her going through all of this.

what's wrong with me? why do i always feel like i have to rescue everybody. i should know by now that no one really wants to be rescued. the human race is flawed in it's own design. we like to complain and make people hear our problems. the worse the problem is, the better the story we get to tell others. it's like we love to soak up all of this, strange energy others give off when we're depressed in between a hard spot and a rock.

not only is sali having shit to deal with, my girlfriend had a shitty day. and now she's being distant, and i can't do anything about that either, because we're already in a long-distance relationship. it's hard enough being far away from one another. now she has to do this. it's not that i'm mad at her. i'm mad at myself, for not being able to help her. for not being able to help sali, or my parents.

i walked into my apartment today, and found my room mate crying and looking at photos. i've never seen him cry. tomorrow's his birthday. he's from a small town in Pennsylvania. in every aspect, he's a stereo-typical small town country boy. but he's honest, smart, out-going, funny, sweet, and caring. he's a really great guy. and he gives off this presence of strength, power. but to see him cry today. it made me realize how vulnerable we all really are. He really misses his family. he's EXTREMELY family oriented. tomorrow's his birthday, and the first birthday he's going to be celebrating without his twin sister, or his mother and father, and brother.

I often find myself thinking, "i wish i could get them to see things the way I see them." i know no one ever can. and i'm not saying everyone should be or think like me. i'm not saying that at all. but i think that my outlook on life, helps me get through things, that i wouldn't be able to get through if i looked at life the way these people do. i looked at life their way before. i got sick of it.

i changed it.

i changed me.

and as a result, my life has already begun to get so much better.

i don't know where this is going anymore. i'm going to close my lap-top now. and get into bed, and go to sleep. i will wake up tomorrow to a new day, and take on the world again.

i'm looking forward to it.

g'night world.

I'm sitting in the laundry room. waiting for my laundry to get done. so i thought i'd update, which is something i haven't done in a while.

so, what's new...

my parents came up to the city this weekend to visit. they're going back to L.A. tomorrow. :( But I was really happy to be bale to spend time with them. My mum's been getting worse. she's getting depressed now. She's so tired of having to go throught her chemo sessions and then have it take everything out of her. that and she isn't getting any better. My pop's worried about her. She's a lot more quiet these days. I'm always worried about her, and i honestly have no idea of how much time i have left with her. i think she's considering stopping her chemo treatments. There's only so much we can do for loved ones before the rest is up to them. i feel so helpless watching her go through this. i try to be strong for her. but some days i honestly think it would just be best to quit school and go back home to L.A. and be with her. At least until she gets better. But i know she wants me to stay in school and that she's never been so proud of me. i feel like sometimes, even though i'm doing all this for myself, that maybe a lot of it is so i can have my mum see me accomplish something with my life. she never followed her dreams, and all my life she told me to do that, if i did anything. she wanted me to be a doctor, or a lawyer, for a while she wanted me to be a model. but she always told me what she really wanted was for me to follow my dreams, but to do it with all my effort and heart. to not half-ass it. my parents are my strength these days. i don't have many friends too close by. and i don't have a significant other to talk to. i spend most of my time with my pencil and markers in my sketch book. i've had a lot of writers block when it comes to poetry and music. but my novel is coming along really well. someone's been telling me how much they love me, and that i was the most amazing thing that's ever happened to her, and that she misses me so much. but i don't know what to do with that. i care about her. a lot. and it never used to bother me. but when i think of what my friends will say if they find out i've started seeing her again. it always seems enough for me to keep my distance. The thing is, none of my friends ever knew her that well. but anyway. i've been doing a lot with school lately. i'm gonna' be starring in 4 student films. I've got a play that i'm working on coming up Dec. 7th. school is amazing, as always. i really love it. I just got hired at Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf and I start work this Friday. um...my band has me, on my clarinet, my room mate Roni plays bass, and our friend T.K. plays guitar. we don't have a drummer or a singer yet, and we don't have a name. Our music is like a mix of jazz and rock. we call it "jock razz". haha. um. yeah. i spend a lot of nights sitting on the pier listening to the water. it's relaxing. we had rain for like two days, it was amazing. i can't wait till it really starts to rain. i love the rain so much. but yeah. that's basically what's been up with my life. in case anyone's been wondering. for the most part i'm not depressed. i have it pretty good up here. it's just when i start thinkin bout my mum that everything starts to get unclear. but i know she wants me here. and i want to be here. so, i guess in some wierd way, i'm doing the right thing by staying here, in my mind. i hope it's the right thing anyway.

well, my laundry's done. night all.

A lot has happened over the past four years. Loves have come and gone, friendships have ended, formed, and grown. Fights have been settled. Tears have been shed, shoulders have been leaned on. And we've all made realizations about our lives, together and apart. I've made bonds with people that will NEVER be separated, no matter how far in time and space we grow apart. And I've lost connections with people I will still always care very deeply about. I realized today that I really miss some things. I miss: * * * * * + + Yeah. A lot has happened, and a lot has been put into my journey that's taken me to where I am now. I'm sittin in a room, in the middle of Downtown San Francisco, California. I'm reminiscing of all the magical moments that are like snap shots in my head and they all fit together to make a portrait of my life so far. Friends past, friends new, friends who stayed strong, and we always knew, we'd stay together. I had a wonderful evening tonight, and it was ended PERFECTLY. I went to an art gallery with my new friends (all of whom are over 21 except my room mate, Roni) After the gallery, we went for pizza and beer. It was wonderful, and...new...different...I started to realize that I'm actually starting a new life up here, and the friends who will most likely be spending the holidays with me and my girlfriend in the future, will be these people. And I almost started to cry. I know I'll never lose certain ties that I've made with people in L.A. But none of us know for sure that they'll be around where I am. Not to say that they should be, just that they most probably won't be. And at dinner tonight, we were already planning our "Thanksmas" holiday. It takes place in between Thanksgiving and Christmas, we ALL get together, everybody brings food and presents and cooks, and we all sit down at a HUGE table and feast and drink, followed by much music making. and we all dress up and spend the night. I know it'll be fun. I guess it's just un-nerving because I always imagined I'd be doing this kind of thing with my other friends. And it's like I have a completely different life up here. People respect me and treat me as an adult, and I can actually relate to everyone on a psychological level, as opposed to just those few friends I really connected with back in L.A. I felt lost once...now I just feel as though I've lost something. I've gained something in return, but part of me if very sad. I think back to when I didn't worry about expenses, bills, how much I was drinking so I could walk back to my place, what time I had to set the alarm so I could get to work on time. I think about how whenever I needed a friend who was so much more than a friend, they were actually family, not only could I call them, I could drive to them. Things will NEVER turn out the way we think they will. They may be worse, they may be better. But I've realized I don't WANT to know what's gonna' happen. I don't want to know if that huge earthquake we've all been expecting is gonna' hit today or tomorrow. I don't want to know if Rebecca and I are gonna' make it. I don't want to know if I'm ever going to actually have two kids, a loving wife, a husky, and a stable in the back full of horses and a vinyard. I just want to know that I'm going to wake up tomorrow, and that it'll be a brand new day, full of new adventures, and new people. I want to know that tomorrow isn't a step closer to the end of my life, but the first day to the rest of my life. I keep people dear and close in my heart, and they're there when I need them. I suppose we all come to this realization one day or another. It's just a matter of when. When we wake up one morning and realize everything's perfect, we have a loving partner, a great job, a smile on our face, and a reason to get our ass out of bed every day. I'll always miss what was, but I'll always look forward to what wil be; the un-expected, the un-known, the exciting, the beautiful, the sad, the wonderful, the hateful, the happy.
